p: In traditional context, the pharmacological effect of medicinal plants is generally ascribed to their active and “safe” content that will only exert quick effect when taken in large quantities [ 22, 33]. Most reviewed reports in this study did not mention the side effects of antimalarial preparations. Nevertheless, herbal preparations from some antimalarial plants were reported to induce vomiting, diarrhea, headache, and urination [ 22, 54] ( Table 2). This may be due to improper dosage, toxic phytochemicals, or metabolic by-products of these preparations [ 22].
